data.title: Every Player to play under 'Sir' Arsene Wenger
data.meta_description: Can you name the Every Player to play under 'Sir' Arsene Wenger? Test your knowledge on this sports quiz and compare your score to others. Quiz by Sweeney09876
data.text:
HintAnswer Long-serving goalkeeper for club Right-back for most of 90's Mr. Arsenal assistant manager to Wenger left-back for much of the 1990's. No-nonsense centre-half captain of Invincibles side The Magic Man (Arsenal's biggest Critic) Is he the guy from Corrie ? Scottish Hero 185 (Fashion Icon) Romford Pele greatest ever import Ended Aston Villa breaking his arm after being dropped by Tony Adams back-up goalkeeper lost spot after emergence of Keown Flop. Moved to USA GO ON Villa caretaker manager Left-footed midfielder The flower of England Third-choice goalkeeper at Highbury No Idea who he is Write Selley Wenger's first signing as Arsenal boss Gunners' chief scout in France left for Barcelona for £25million in 2000 World Cup winning midfielder decent Fulham Player followed Wenger from Monaco not Russell Crowe its jason A local lad (YOU WOULDN'T THINK IT) Nearly won a Champ League with Liverpool Plucked from non-league German football by Wenger grandson of former Libyan prime minister Mahmud al-Muntasir 21 England caps after leaving Arsenal CB racked up 13 different clubs eturning to France after less than a year at the club. Argentinian defender Underwear Model Did his best work in Turkey in the mid-noughties A left-back who made a handful of Gunners appearances Now a politician in Asuncion Part of the Gunners' 1994 FA Youth Cup winning side leggy Nigerian striker Soviet Union international Brazil who displaced Nigel Winterburn The God Of Arsenal Now runs an academy in Croatia Last spotted managing second division women's side Niederkirchen Probaly the best Left back ever to play in the Prem. (Most hated man in england) Ended his playing darts at Debden Sports Club, Local, Welsh Player Appeared on Big Brother Graham Barrett Irish forward Sold to Crystal Palace for £500,000 in 2000 Irish defender penalty-taker-extraordinaire That Peno scoring the goal against Man United at Old Trafford that won the league in 2001/02 I'll give you this one 'Canoville' Back-up to the back-ups Goalie high work rate but not enough talent German Useless Latvian CB The Lithuanian striker took the phrase 'journeyman' to new levels valuable squad member during his four-year spell at Arsenal Managed to shake off the spursness and became a winner with Arsenal (For Free) Dutch defender fox-in-the-box Arrived at Arsenal in time to win a medal. Left that summer. You only got him because of Ian Wright Sent off on Debut Born in DR Congo but raised in England play for both Arsenal and Tottenham

HintAnswer The Greek centre-back moved to Lille in 2003 signed as a 16-year-old and was likened to Thierry Henry A defensive midfielder A diminutive Brazilian left-back One of the most under-rated players ever YAYA YAYA YAYA YAYA YAYA TOURE... Bald French defender Our answer to Giggs (Garry) Swedish keeper retired after falling out of love with the game joining Middlesbrough for £3million in 2008 the eccentric German saved Juan Roman Riquelme’s penalty to secure a place in the 2006 Champions League final Irish keeper The Romford-born midfielder made just one League Cup appearance for the club Tricky winger who joined from Luton as a schoolboy Joined the Gunners academy in 2002 from Ajax back-up to Ashley Cole I'd take him back Left-footed winger last seen playing in Greece for Skoda Xanthi League Cup win over Wolves in December 2003 Icelandic international midfielder who can now been seen plying his trade in Turkey with Genclerbirligi Striker who has six caps for the Czech Republic Spanish forward who arrived from Sevilla in 2004 for £17million Top of my hate list Van Pursestrings Arsenals Next Owner Swedish Free Kick Specialist now scouts for Arsenal in north America Swiss international who was sold after failing to cut errors out of his game He was so dramatic in Goals he looks alright but wasn't Who ?.... Lupoli One of a number of bumbling centre-backs to stick around for a few seasons....Bald now plays for Shamrock Rovers. A cult figure among fans for his personality and attacking raids from right-back. Ruined if carrer by leaving for Barca broke supporters' hearts by jumping ship to Barcelona Had a heart attack against Spurs now playing for Celtic The world's greatest player... but only in his own mind. Willesden-born defender Bones made of Glass...World Class his post-Arsenal career has made him a pariah. 'Little Mozart' The definition of unfilled potential This Brazilian was world class and Wenger didn't like him Moved to north London as part of the Ashley Cole deal Defender who now plays for Cardiff looked like the next big thing but then faded One of Arsenal's big hopes, he never lived up to the billing. Technically gifted left-back, he proved a touch lightweight to stake a real claim His name could have been fun..Poom plucked from Auxerre and went on to be a Premier League regular We would have won the Prem if he didn't get injured This guy actauly still plays with PSG 'FlappyHandski' Expected to become a star after youth team exploits but progress stalled. now playing for Utrecht in his homeland Left and got relegated at West Brom ondon-born defender who now plies his trade at Barnet One great year and so many average ones Cashed in to Manchester City played for David Moyes at Real Sociedad It hurts that he's gone but its for the Best.. They say made a sensational return to become a key man Villa Midfielder joined Hull in 2010. A weird signing from Manchester United A shock addition in 2008 now on loan at Braga from Benfica Not the singer started with a bang but couldn't keep it up GK with a name like a Candy Bar Never should have left for Barca I like the Sun. u ? too many high-profile mistakes GK
